@daniel460 if you were getting stuck on Black Ops 2 using RGH here is how you make it play. I have RGH and was having same problem. You need to update to Dashlaunch 3.02.  After running dashlaunch on your Xbox click the RB button until you get to the Misc menu. Click on Uninstall. All it does is remove dashlaunch from your systems flash memory. Then click on Launch and select Black Ops 2. The game will run fine now. If you are trying to boot the game from XEXMenu or older version of Dashlaunch, it will get stuck when you start the game. Try that and let me know if it helps you. Worked like a charm for me and everyone else I showed how to do it.
11 hours in and at 90.08% FUCKING SEED!!!!! This is just sad.

@daahouse If youre game is freezing on BO2 using RGH Xbox. Follow these steps. You need to be using Dashlaunch 3.02. If you are trying to load the game using an older version or using XEXMenu, the game will freeze when trying to load the first mission. 

Load Dashlaunch and click RB button til you get to Misc. menu.  Click on uninstall option, which removes it from system flash. Then click on launch option and select the game. Now it will load up with no problems. Try that and let me know how it worked for you.

@jakenator and realagent  Most people think that if they set their upload speed real low that they will download the game faster when exactly the opposite is true. The faster you share the game the faster you get information from the game. I can understand setting your upload speed a little lower if you have bandwith caps, but if you dont, dont mess with your upload speed. Your upload speed will NOT affect your download speed at all. Having a high upload rate doesnt make you download slower. Help everyone out. I was going pretty fast for first few hours, now Im lucky to get 10kb.

@dunit80 I am aware of that and thats why people seed even after downloading to help the rest of us. Also I have dashlaunch 3.04 and it loads games like Call of Duty Black Ops 2 just fine, so maybe it will work for this.

Just download, extract with XBOX Image Browser and play straight from an external drive or USB flash drive.
